title: UTMB Announcements for 9/8/2023
cleaned_text: publication rules.](http://www.utmb.edu/announcements/guidelines.asp) [Check the Events Calendar for today.](http://www.utmb.edu/calendar) | | | | The Center for Health-system Improvement (CHI) is dedicated to bridging the gap between the desire to improve clinical care and rigorous research methodology, helping to transform UTMB into a learning health system. We hold bi-monthly works-in-progress seminars where UTMB faculty and trainees discuss projects in various stages of development. This week's presentation will be given on September 12th by Dr. Fangjian Guo on the "Cost effectiveness analyses of population based multi-gene testing for the prevention of breast and ovarian cancer in the United States". Please email [Click for more to List of Announcements](#top) | | TODAY IS THE LAST DAY IN LEAGUE CITY FOR K'S CREATIONS!!! Come and take advantage of the last day for K's Creations. Folks are buzzing about the fun items and good service. Check out a great collection of gifts including women's clothing and accessories, scarves, fashion jewelry, and lots of new merchandise (Fall t-shirts and floral), and clearance items. It's such an easy way to shop! FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 8TH 8:00 A.M. - 3:00 P.M. LEAGUE CITY CAMPUS (CLINIC SIDE) - 1ST FLOOR Cash, MasterCard, Visa, Discover, and American Express are all accepted. Proceeds benefit patient and volunteer programs. THANK YOU FOR YOUR CONTINUED SUPPORT! [Mary Moody](mailto:mmoody@utmb.edu?subject=LAST DAY FOR K'S CREATIONS IN LEAGUE CITY!!!)For: Volunteer Services Phone: (409) 772-2549 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | The deadline for poster submissions has been extended to noon on Friday, Sept. 8th! The GSBS is proud to announce the launch of the annual GSBS Research Expo that will showcase all of our trainees and offer an amazing Dean's Lecture Keynote speaker! Please mark your calendars for Friday, September 22, 2023 from 11am-5pm and come check out the poster sessions, informational tables, and network with faculty and trainees from across the UTMB campus. The Dean's Lecture will begin at 4pm and features Dr. Jesse Erasmus, a former student at the GSBS who received his Ph.D. under the direction of Dr. Scott Weaver. Dr. Erasmus is currently the Director of Virology at HDT Bio in Seattle, WA, where he works to develop new RNA vaccines and other therapeutic technologies. Poster submission instructions: All GSBS students, postdocs, and medical students working in GSBS labs are invited to present a poster. Please click the following link to register your poster: [GSBS Research Expo Poster Registration (office.com)](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2FPages%2FResponsePage.aspx%3Fid%3DbSXve9uFJkWnLTGuolRoUrlTY297YR9Jn_n7zlpM14dUNkJEUE1WVjROTzhJVkRPQkdFRFdOUUJUNSQlQCN0PWcu&data=05%7C01%7Cdjreed%40UTMB.EDU%7Cca56fd7b61b945e01fb708dbab33150a%7C7bef256d85db4526a72d31aea2546852%7C0%7C0%7C638292008169115296%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=UPI9ZNyGtGU4TfkvBST7suhpcKg%2FkSoJPJ50D40tYzI%3D&reserved=0) The deadline for submission has been extended to September 8th. We encourage all trainees preparing a poster to use the new UTMB templates (including ones with the GSBS logo) available through BioRender. To view these templates, sign in to BioRender here and click "Posters": [https://app.biorender.com/user/signin](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fapp.biorender.com%2Fuser%2Fsignin&data=05%7C01%7Cdjreed%40UTMB.EDU%7Cca56fd7b61b945e01fb708dbab33150a%7C7bef256d85db4526a72d31aea2546852%7C0%7C0%7C638292008169115296%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=7EI8pjAMb9kRYZrPhSjdjL4Sw5is1hbAyuT7UuKMOxQ%3D&reserved=0). Use of BioRender is FREE to anyone on the UTMB campus! Simply log in using your UTMB credentials and you will have access to this amazing software that allows you to create beautiful posters, figures, and more! | | GSBS Research Expo Schedule | | Location: Levin Hall, Second Floor | | Time | | Activity | | 11:00-1:15pm | | Poster Session A & Informational Tables | | 1:30-3:45pm | | Poster Session B & Informational Tables | | 4:00-5:00pm | | Dean's Lecture - Don't miss out on the informational tables during the poster sessions! - Connect with leaders from the GSBS Writing Studio, Gulf Coast Consortia (GCC), Blackstone LaunchPad, and more! - Grab some swag, meet someone new, and learn more about all the opportunities available to you! - Hors d'oeuvres will be served during both poster sessions! [Click for more information](https://www.utmb.edu/gsbs/about/news/gsbs-research-expo) [Denise Reed](mailto:djreed@utmb.edu?subject=DEADLINE @ NOON TODAY - Poster Submission Research Expo)For: Graduate School (GSBS) Phone: 8329510084 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | ***Families, caregivers, patients, staff and students are welcome to attend these sessions*** September 12th Session- 12p-1p via Zoom Presented by: Alex Rischan- Lead H-GAC (Houston-Galveston Area Council) Topic: "Medicare 101" Overview: Join us for a presentation that reviews the basics of Medicare. Attendees will learn about the different coverage options available through Medicare and important deadlines to sign-up. This presentation will also go over programs available to assist individuals with Medicare costs and will review ways Medicare beneficiaries can avoid common pitfalls to make sure they have quality access to healthcare. Open Enrollment is coming up, so now is the perfect time to empower yourself with knowledge to make the best plan decisions for you and those you care for! Hosted by: Health Resource Center Join Zoom Webinar: [https://zoom.us/j/95676424260?pwd=MGdhZ3RhQk9lUzZ3WFJyVlVDMmQxQT09](https://zoom.us/j/95676424260?pwd=MGdhZ3RhQk9lUzZ3WFJyVlVDMmQxQT09) Passcode: 268583 Or One tap mobile : +13462487799,,95676424260#,,,,*268583# US (Houston) +12532050468,,95676424260#,,,,*268583# US Or Telephone: Dial(for higher quality, dial a number based on your current location): +1 346 248 7799 to List of Announcements](#top) | | BOOKS AND GIFTS AT GREAT SAVINGS! [Mary Moody](mailto:mmoody@utmb.edu?subject=COLLECTIVE GOODS BOOK FAIR WILL BE IN GALVESTON MONDAY, TUESDAY, AND WEDNESDAY!!!)For: Volunteer Services Phone: (409) 772-2549 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | UTMB is a proud sponsor of the 2023 Walk to End Alzheimer's - Bay Area/Galveston County The 2023 Walk is on Saturday, Oct. 14, 2023 8am at Stewart Beach, Galveston Seven UTMB departments have already registered a team for this year's Walk. [UTMB Administrative Professional Association](https://act.alz.org/site/TR/Walk2023/TX-HoustonampSoutheastTexas?team_id=803502&pg=team&fr_id=16970) [UTMB Gold Humanism Honor Society](https://act.alz.org/site/TR/Walk2023/TX-HoustonampSoutheastTexas?team_id=815619&pg=team&fr_id=16970) Let's get ALL 4 UTMB campuses to participate and show our patients and our community that Together, We Can End Alzheimer's Disease. Many people with Alzheimer's and other dementia and their family caregivers come to our campuses looking for hope and help. While there is no cure for Alzheimer's disease at this time, our physicians, nurses and staff offer their best care and management of symptoms. Our research teams are looking for ways to prevent or cure this devastating disease and to support those already diagnosed. The Alzheimer's Association Walk to End Alzheimer's is the world's largest fundraiser for Alzheimer's care, support and research. The Walk is non-competitive and is family and dog friendly. Walk, run or stroll the 5K beach route OR the route of your choice where you live or work. Start or Join a UTMB Walk Team TODAY! Visit the Bay Area/Galveston County Walk Home Page to sign up! [https://utmb.us/a17](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Futmb.us%2Fa17&data=05%7C01%7Calwillia%40UTMB.EDU%7Cb434b2101731440493f608dba988d6fd%7C7bef256d85db4526a72d31aea2546852%7C0%7C0%7C638290177418262412%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=pUiGnOxzKxL4aCPYy7h0KHvo673JlP0oBSLofNK78zc%3D&reserved=0) [Click more Aging Phone: 409.266.9647 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | The Administrative Professionals Association (APA) and Women's Resource Group (WRG) invite you to an Alzheimer's Educational Seminar given by Susan Leining. The HEC is located at 301 11th Street, Galveston. Please visit this link to register: [https://forms.office.com/r/VaCvgiCMqs](https://forms.office.com/r/VaCvgiCMqs) Seminar)For: to List of Announcements](#top) | | The PDA and Office of Postdoctoral Affairs is proud to announce our 2023 National Postdoc Appreciation Week schedule of events. This week will be full of various events, workshops, seminars and awards available to all Postdoctoral Scholars. Please note that some of these events are virtual, while others are in person and may require registration to attend. The National Postdoc Association will also be hosting a wide variety of workshops and seminars virtually. For that schedule of events [please click here](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nationalpostdoc.org%2Fpage%2F2023NPAW&data=05%7C01%7Csngabric%40UTMB.EDU%7C0cb077c03eb64c4a0c0d08dbaf019928%7C7bef256d85db4526a72d31aea2546852%7C0%7C0%7C638296195045609942%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=%2FzXXqIaXonrInCIkOd%2BawGxNs05dPr6EXji6j3R%2B9wg%3D&reserved=0). The Postdoc Appreciation Week Awards descriptions can be found below along with the schedule of in person, UTMB events: Monday, September 18: UTMB Health Research Expert Profile Workshop and Professional Portraits. [UTMB Health Research Expert Profile with Professional Head shots (office.com)](https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=bSXve9uFJkWnLTGuolRoUlWL1RrsGdBHtWjCO3w6FEpUQzQ3TjlaNVZNVTRSNTVONDJSTFNLSEJJVC4u&web=1&wdLOR=cEB5E5E5A-9836-4281-89B0-C585A8828E8B) Monday, September 18: UTMB Health Research Expert Profile Workshop and Professional Portraits.This event is by registration only: Tuesday, September 19: Internal and External Communication That Builds Connections and Community with Cara Geary.This event is by registration only: [Internal and External Communication that Build Connection and Community with Cara Geary (office.com)](https://forms.office.com/pages/responsepage.aspx?id=bSXve9uFJkWnLTGuolRoUlWL1RrsGdBHtWjCO3w6FEpUOTJIVjg4UkUzVFoyRjc5QUVTTUlGRzdXTC4u&web=1&wdLOR=c6C5C23B5-C47E-4E47-A6D7-CED063C12AD8). Registration will close on Wednesday, September 13th. Wednesday, September 20: PDA Potluck and Award Ceremony. Please stop by for a chance to win door prizes. Thursday, September 21: Now That I Got Funded, What's Next? Panel Discussion with Anna Fracassi, Bryan Johnson and Rafael Campos. HEC 3.222. Refreshments will be provided. Friday, September 22: GSBS Research Expo and Dean's Lecture. Please stop by the PDA table for Swag! PDA Award Applications: Please submit your self-nominations no later than September 15th at 5PM. To self-nominate for these awards, please send a brief response to either of the following prompts using the following link [https://forms.office.com/r/jqXvYmCgwk](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fforms.office.com%2Fr%2FjqXvYmCgwk&data=05%7C01%7Csngabric%40UTMB.EDU%7C0cb077c03eb64c4a0c0d08dbaf019928%7C7bef256d85db4526a72d31aea2546852%7C0%7C0%7C638296195045609942%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Gj6rDeehD1DS2eUPGzLWQSYeK2IKkMbvtxzn25bzHYg%3D&reserved=0): RESEARCH EXCELLENCE AWARD $250.00 Cash Prize: Summarize your research efforts from the last year highlighting the importance of your publications, presentations, and grant proposals/funding for the period from September 2022-September 2023. SERVICE AWARD $250.00 Cash Prize: Summarize your service for the past year potentially including mentoring, teaching, committee involvement, reviewer activities, outreach, service to professional organizations, and volunteerism for the period from September 2022-September 2023. EUREKA EVOLUTION AWARDS $200.00 Cash Prize : Navigating your best lab failures and/or innovations through a brief description during your scientific career. This could be at any point during your postdoc appointment. If you have any questions or concerns, please reach out to [Melanie Connolly](mailto:meconnol@utmb.edu?subject=Innovation UTMB!)For: Team Phone: (409) 772-0303 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | The Health Education Center (HEC) & Office of Interprofessional Education (IPE) would like to invite you to join us for Faculty and Staff Orientation. The event is open to all faculty and staff who would like to learn more about the HEC & IPE. Date: Tuesday, October 17, 2023, 9am-12pm Health Education Center Please register using the link below: [https://www.eventbrite.com/e/utmb-hec-ipe-faculty-orientation-tickets-478955788657](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.eventbrite.com%2Fe%2Futmb-hec-ipe-faculty-orientation-tickets-478955788657&data=05%7C01%7Cermcgoff%40UTMB.EDU%7C790aedade8be4287c0b208dad3b25f04%7C7bef256d85db4526a72d31aea2546852%7C0%7C0%7C638055060294304839%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=Lv0EeeYD2ZRxYSIipunkB%2F3s8gQKeal%2FohXFCNF39%2BA%3D&reserved=0) If you have any questions, please contact: Dr. Erin McGoff, Assistant Vice President, HEC and Simulation [ermcgoff@utmb.edu](mailto:ermcgoff@utmb.edu) 409-266-0010 Ms. Shelley Smith, Director of [Click for more information](https://www.eventbrite.com/e/utmb-hec-ipe-faculty-orientation-tickets-478955788657) [Erin McGoff](mailto:ermcgoff@utmb.edu?subject=HEC Staff Orientation)For: Health Education Center Phone: 409-266-0010 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | DMAC Workshop Data Management and Analysis Core for Comparative Effectiveness Research on Cancer in Texas Funded by CPRIT October 3rd, 2023 12:30pm-5pm Moody Gardens Convention Center Room: Viewfinder Terrace 7 Hope Blvd, Galveston, TX 77554 October 4th, 2023 By Appointment UTMB 301 University Blvd, Galveston, TX 77555 For Investigators who would like to get consultations for specific projects Presented by UTMB Health School of Public and Population Health Lunch will be provided at 1st come 1st serve on October 3rd, 2023. [https://www.utmb.edu/spph/department/of-biostatistics-data-science/data-management-and-analysis-core/research-on-cancer-in-texas-workshop](https://www.utmb.edu/spph/department/of-biostatistics-data-science/data-management-and-analysis-core/research-on-cancer-in-texas-workshop) Please contact Monica Cline at 409-772-6355 or via email [mjcline@utmb.edu](mailto:mjcline@utmb.edu) Please follow the following link to register for this Workshop: [https://utmb.us/8w1](https://utmb.us/8w1) [Monica Cline](mailto:mjcline@utmb.edu?subject=DMAC Workshop: Data Management and Analysis Core for Comparative Effectiveness Research on Cancer in Texas.)For: Office Of Biostatistics Phone: 4097726355 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | The Sealy Institute for Vaccine Sciences Clinical Trials Program is recruiting healthy volunteers who are 9-25 years of age for a cytomegalovirus vaccine clinical trial. You may qualify if you: Are a male aged 9-15 years or a female aged 9-25 years Are in general good health Are not currently pregnant or breastfeeding Additional requirements apply, which the study team can discuss with you. Reimbursement for time and travel is provided. Please contact Cori Burkett-Merrifield at cmburket@utmb.edu or (409) 772-5426 for more information. [Cori Burkett-Merrifield](mailto:cmburket@utmb.edu?subject=CMV Vaccine Study - RECRUITING NOW!)For: Sealy Institute for Vaccine Sciences Phone: (409) 772-5426 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | Samuel G. Dunn Lectureship in the Medical Humanities Presents: "The Spirit of Asilomar" by Dr. Luis Campos Department of History Rice University Baker College Chair for the History of Science, Technology, and Innovation Thursday, September 14, 2023 12-1 pm HEC 3.222 OR Register for Zoom here: [https://zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_yWgQXgOAToK1aQl8ICDibg](https://nam11.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fzoom.us%2Fwebinar%2Fregister%2FWN_yWgQXgOAToK1aQl8ICDibg&data=05%7C01%7Ckddunn%40UTMB.EDU%7Cee5f3306a0834bf39cbf08dba423bb99%7C7bef256d85db4526a72d31aea2546852%7C0%7C0%7C638284245592119349%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=lHr%2BINaQim7CEqI7bcFcIoI7AiVuCbwOxAgmzdA1hYU%3D&reserved=0) Abstract: From the dawn of genetic engineering and the emergence of synthetic biology to the prospects for germline genome engineering today, biologists and their interlocutors have frequently referred to the 1975 meeting at Asilomar (on the potential biohazards of new recombinant DNA techniques) as a touchstone for contemporary issues. They debate whether "Asilomar" was a paradigmatic or exemplary event; recount how it unfolded and what it all meant for laboratory protocols, research agendas, scientific governance, and for society at large; and question whether "another Asilomar" meeting is necessary today to deal with the emergence of newer techniques in biotechnology. But with so many contested meanings does it make sense to speak of a unitary 'spirit of Asilomar'? In this talk, I will explore the resonances and tensions between the famed historical Asilomar (which saw itself as a future-directed event), and contemporary claims for its putative lessons. As memories, folk histories, and competing analyses intersect with the pressing demands of cutting-edge science, 'the spirit of Asilomar' remains a contested reference point, haunting science-and-society relations and the emergence of new prospects in biology today. [Kathryne Dunn](mailto:kddunn@utmb.edu?subject=BHH Samuel G. Dunn Lectureship Series Presents, ''The Spirit of Asilomar'' by Dr. Luis Campos)For: The School of Public and Population Health Phone: 409-772-1128 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | The continual learning and development of employees is essential to UTMB's mission, vision and values and having a growth mindset can help you excel in your role and prepare for future opportunities. Did you know that you can gauge your proficiency in a particular skill through the university's digital learning platform? Powered by Skillsoft Percipio, the platform uses skill benchmarksto measure your capabilities against specific objectives defined by leading subject matter experts. The skill benchmarks will help to identify your knowledge gaps, so that you can focus on the skills you need to improve and not on those you already know. The platform offers hundreds of skill benchmarks. To find a skill benchmark: - Go to [https://utmb.percipio.com/](https://utmb.percipio.com/)and log in using your UTMB username and password. - Enter skill benchmark in the search box. - Filter by subject, expertise and/or duration. - Select the skill benchmark you want to take and answer each question. After you answer all the questions, you'll immediately receive a proficiency rating: - Novice (0-9 points): Novice means that you are starting with very limited familiarity on the topics critical for the skill. - Aspiring (10-49 points): Aspiring means that you have demonstrated minimal capabilities for the specific skill and should make an investment in learning to achieve proficiency. - Developing (50-69 points): Developing means that you have some proficiency with the specific skill and only need to close a few knowledge gaps to achieve proficiency. - Proficient (70-89 points): Proficiency means that you have met the criteria for applying your knowledge with the skill to practical challenges in your work. We recommend you strive to achieve a minimum level of Proficiency for the skills you are developing. - Advanced (90-100 points): Advanced means that you demonstrate a thorough understanding of the skill and may be able to mentor other learners within your organization. You'll also be presented with targeted learning content based on your level of readiness and goals. You can take a skill benchmark as many times as you want, and the platform will track your scores to see your improvement over time. If you're a manager, you can use the platform to assign a skill benchmark to your team as well as learning content to improve their competency with a high focus skill. This may be an excellent approach if, for example, your team is struggling to improve customer service perceptions. It would allow employees to know where they should focus their personal development to achieve a team objective. Improvements can then be measured by employees' skill benchmark scores and departmental outcomes. For more information about UTMB's digital learning platform, including user videos and guides, visit [https://utmb.us/70m](https://utmb.us/70m). [Laurie Winslow](mailto:lawinslo@UTMB.EDU?subject=Know where you are today and prepare for tomorrow with skill benchmarks through UTMB's digital learning platform)For: Human Resources Phone: 409-266-1203 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | | | The University of Texas Medical Branch (UTMB), the U.S. Health and Human Services Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and The University of Nebraska Medical Center (UNMC) - Global Center for Health Security (GCHS) are pleased to announce the upcoming 2023 Achieving Data Quality and Integrity in Clinical Trials Involving High Consequence Pathogens course! This is a free course and will be held October 4-6, 2023, at UNMC - GCHS with the option to attend in-person (Oct. 4-6, 2.5 days) and virtually (Oct. 4-5, 2 days). As an attendee, you will hear from subject matter experts and dive into panel discussions with stellar faculty! Target Audience: Physicians, Scientists, Principal Investigators, Physician Assistants, Nurse Practitioners, Nurses, Pharmacists, Clinical laboratorians, Clinical research staff, Regulators, Policy-makers, Clinical monitors, Regulatory reviewers, Biosafety professionals, IRB professionals, and Sponsors. Benefits of attending in-person include: To learn more, visit: To 15, 2023): 22, 2023) Questions? Email us at: In-person spots are limited - register now! [Click for more information](https://www.utmb.edu/orncs/regulatory-ops/clinical-course) [Katherine Rosen](mailto:kerosen@utmb.edu?subject=2023 Achieving Data Quality and Integrity in Clinical Trials Involving High Consequence Pathogens - Free Course!)For: Institutional Office of Regulated Nonclinical Studies Phone: 4097478138 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | Moment of Hope Each week the Pastoral Care Department brings you a Moment of Hope - a brief prayer or poem to help give you peace, encouragement, and hope. [Click here to listen](https://liveutmb.sharepoint.com/:u:/s/collaboration/webfiles/ERLEkIAxHVNGr_s3-Mhbml4BIpiU9TtI0egKKGtTDWfG4Q?e=l6cPI0&nav=eyJyZWZlcnJhbEluZm8iOnsicmVmZXJyYWxBcHAiOiJTdHJlYW1XZWJBcHAiLCJyZWZlcnJhbFZpZXciOiJTaGFyZURpYWxvZyIsInJlZmVycmFsQXBwUGxhdGZvcm0iOiJXZWIiLCJyZWZlcnJhbE1vZGUiOiJ2aWV3In19) to this week's Moment of Hope. A prayer for Labor Day which was September 4. Dear God, Today, we pray for your peace. We pray that the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard our hearts and minds. We also ask for courage. We remember that God did not give us a spirit of fear, but of power and love and a sound mind. Please, grant us your spirit of courage. Grant us a sound mind as we make decisions. We pray for all the physicians, nurses, health care providers, and support staff at UTMB. We thank you for the work we get to do every day - that we help bring healing, peace, and comfort to our patients, their family members, and each other. May You bless us with the wisdom and grace needed to provide the best care possible. In Your name we pray, Amen. [Chaplain Jenny Schindler](mailto:jbschind@utmb.edu?subject=Your Weekly Anchor)For: Pastoral Care Phone: 409-772-3979 [Back to List of Announcements](#top) | | We are recruiting female volunteers to complete a research study determining the metabolic risks of polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) across the lifespan We are looking for female volunteers who: - Are 50-62 years old and postmenopausal - Have no history of hyperandrogenism or PCOS - Have a body mass index between 18.5 - 40 kg/m2 - Have no medical history of surgical menopause, recent diagnosis/treatment of cancer (within 3 years) or hormone replacement therapy (within 6 months) - Access to an electronic device with virtual/video capabilities The study will ask you to complete questionnaires and participate in one visit to UTMB-Galveston campus where you will complete a blood draw and DEXA scan for body composition. Results from your visit will be made available to you. In total, the questionnaires and campus visit will take approximately 2 hours. You will be reimbursed for time, travel and parking.
